intro: Tetrapilus gagnepainii, commonly known as the Gagnepain's tetrapilus, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments within the rainforests of Madagascar. Its botanical features include a woody stem with persistent, lobed leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its restricted habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
